author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Aluminum Climbs on Report Deripaska Wants to Keep Control of Rusal
text:
Aluminum prices swung wildly Thursday, extending their bout of volatility after Bloomberg reported Russian metals tycoon Oleg Deripaska hopes to keep control of United Co. Rusal even after the U.S. hinted it might relieve sanctions against the company if Mr. Deripaska sells his stake.
Aluminum for delivery in three months climbed as much as 3.2% on the news and closed up 1.3% at $2,275.00 a metric ton. Shares of aluminum producer Alcoa Corp. added 2%.
